doc.field: The Mariano Montagnino papers contain a small number of items documenting Montagnino's early life. Materials include Montagnino's diploma from David A. Boody Junior High School, a graduation commencement program, and an autograph book containing inscriptions from classmates and school faculty, all from 1933. One yearbook from the school, dated 1952, is also included. Also included is Montagnino's United States Coast Guard identification card from 1942, and three photographs of Montagnino and unknown individuals, circa 1930s.

The Mariano Montagnino papers contain a small number of items documenting Montagnino's early life. Materials include Montagnino's diploma from David A. Boody Junior High School, a graduation commencement program, and an autograph book containing inscriptions from classmates and school faculty, all from 1933. One yearbook from the school, dated 1952, is also included. Also included is Montagnino's United States Coast Guard identification card from 1942, and three photographs of Montagnino and unknown individuals, circa 1930s.

The Mariano Montagnino papers contain a small number of items documenting Montagnino's early life. Materials include Montagnino's diploma from David A. Boody Junior High School, a graduation commencement program, and an autograph book containing inscriptions from classmates and school faculty, all from 1933. One yearbook from the school, dated 1952, is also included. Also included is Montagnino's United States Coast Guard identification card from 1942, and three photographs of Montagnino and unknown individuals, circa 1930s.

Mariano Montagnino was born in New York on January 20, 1916, and attended David A. Boody Junior High School in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Gravesend, where he was voted Best Athlete by his peers, and from which he graduated in 1933. In 1942 he joined the the United States Coast Guard.
